recipe.title: Burst Cherry Tomato and Pesto Pasta with Toasted Pine Nuts

ingredients.name: Pasta
ingredients.notes: Linguini or pasta shape of choice

ingredients.name: Pesto
ingredients.notes: Homemade or store-bought, more to taste

steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook according to package directions until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup of pasta water before draining.
While the pasta cooks, toast the pine nuts in a teaspoon of olive oil over medium heat, stirring constantly until lightly golden. Remove from the pan and set aside.

In the same pan, heat the remaining olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the halved cherry tomatoes, garlic and red pepper flakes (if using). Sauté, shaking the pan occasionally, until the tomatoes begin to blister and burst, about 8-10 minutes.
Stir in the balsamic vinegar and simmer for 1 minute.
Drain the pasta and add it to the pan with the cherry tomato sauce. Toss to combine.
Stir in the pesto, adding a little reserved pasta water at a time until the sauce reaches your desired consistency.
Serve immediately, garnished with toasted pine nuts, shaved parmesan cheese, and fresh basil leaves.
recipe.notes: For a richer flavor, roast the cherry tomatoes at 400°F (200°C) for 20 minutes before adding them to the pan.
